member.name: T:DrawPanelLibrary.CartesianPlane
member.summary: A DrawingPanel with Cartesian Plane coordinate system. Origin (0, 0) is in middle of window, coordinates are "normal" - y increases bottom to top. Note: because coordinate system is flipped vertically relative to DrawingPanel, Rectangles are defined as (bottom, left, width, height) Incomplete - text, when drawn, is upside down.

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.CartesianPlane.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a CartesianPlane with default width and height

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.CartesianPlane.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a DrawingPanel with the given width and height

member.name: T:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel
member.summary: A window you can draw into

member.name: F:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.DefaultPanelDimension
member.summary: When no dimensions specified, DrawingPanels are DefaultPanelDimension X DefaultPanelDimension

member.name: P:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.DumpFilePrefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that all logged image files start with. By default, this is the current assembly name.

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.LogOutput(System.Int32)
member.summary: Controls logging of images to disc
member.param: max files to keep (0 to turn off logging)

member.name: F:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.Input
member.summary: provides access to events and state involving keyboard and mouse when DrawingPanel window is active

member.name: F:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.Menus
member.summary: allows addition and use of custom menu commands in DrawingPanelwindow

member.name: F:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.graphics
member.summary: used to draw into this DrawingPanel's bitmap

member.name: P:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.Width
member.summary: Width of drawing surface

member.name: P:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.Height
member.summary: Height of drawing surface

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a DrawingPanel with the given width and height

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a DrawingPanel with default width and height

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.#ctor(System.Drawing.Image)
member.summary: Creates a DrawingPanel pre-filled with the given image. Dimensions match the image's pixel dimensions (ignoring physical size and DPI properties).

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.GetGraphics
member.summary: Get a Graphics object that can draw into the DrawingPanel

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.RefreshDisplay
member.summary: Updates display with everything drawn to this point

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.GetPixelArray
member.summary: Returns a 2D array containing the pixels as currently displayed. Color stored at [x, y] corresponds to pixel at (x, y) in DrawingPanel

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.OverWriteDisplay(System.Drawing.Color[0:,0:])
member.summary: Replaces the currently displayed image with the pixels of the given 2D array. Color [x, y] in array will be displayed at location (x, y) in DrawingPanel

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Save contents of DrawingPanel as a PNG file with the given filename. If filename has an extension other than .png, that extension is removed and replaced with .png

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.Pause
member.summary: Pauses program with default message displayed in message box

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.Pause(System.String)
member.summary: Pauses program, with given message displayed in message box

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.Zoom(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the display's magnifaction to the given zoom factor

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.HideWindow
member.summary: Hides window (DrawingPanel still exists, but will have no display shown)

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.ShowWindow
member.summary: Shows window (makes previously hidden window visible again)

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.MoveWindow(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves window to given location. (x, y) specifies where top left of window will be after the move.

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingPanel.GetWindowLocation
member.summary: Gets window's current location (top left of window)

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingWindow.ZoomWindow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Zoom display to given zoom factor. Can be safely called from another (i.e. DrawingPanel's) thread.

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingWindow.AwaitFormDisplay
member.summary: Call this method whenever code depends on this Form's window having been properly created/displayed. Possibly not the best way to handle the issue, but makes sense to me, and appears to work well.

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingWindow.SafeHide
member.summary: Hides window in cross-thread-safe fashion

member.name: M:DrawPanelLibrary.DrawingWindow.SafeShow
member.summary: Shows window in cross-thread-safe fashion

member.summary: Holds information associated with a mouse click

member.name: P:UI.ClickInfo.Location
member.summary: current location of mouse

member.name: P:UI.ClickInfo.X
member.summary: x-coordinate of mouse's current location

member.name: P:UI.ClickInfo.Y
member.summary: y-coordinate of mouse's current location

member.name: P:UI.ClickInfo.LeftClick
member.summary: true if left mouse button is currently down

member.name: P:UI.ClickInfo.RightClick
member.summary: true if right mouse button is currently down

member.name: P:UI.ClickInfo.MiddleClick
member.summary: true if middle mouse button is currently down

member.name: M:UI.ClickInfo.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of this instance to its equivalent string representation

member.name: T:UI.ICustomMenus
member.summary: Provides a means of modifying a Windows Form's menus
member.remarks: Implementor is of course responsible for limiting the manner in which items are added and removed. In particular, implementor should protect its existing / internally used menu items from being removed. Suggested mechanism: maintain a collection of all items added by outside code, and allow only those items to be removed by RemoveMenuItem.

member.name: M:UI.ICustomMenus.GetMainMenus
member.summary: Gives outside code access to main menus

member.name: M:UI.ICustomMenus.AddMenuItem(System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem,System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection)
member.summary: Allows outside code to add custom commands, handled by that outside code

member.name: M:UI.ICustomMenus.RemoveMenuItem(System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem,System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection)
member.summary: Allows outside code to remove custom commands that it added earlier

member.name: M:UI.ICustomMenus.ReplaceExitHandler(System.EventHandler,System.Object)
member.summary: Allows outside code to override automatic handling of Exit command (usually File/Exit)

member.name: T:UI.MenuManager
member.summary: Manages addition and use of custom menus

member.name: M:UI.MenuManager.#ctor(UI.ICustomMenus)
member.summary: Creates a MenuManager for menus added to the given MenuStrip

member.name: M:UI.MenuManager.AddMenu(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new menu with the given title. Title must be non-blank, and can't include the character '/'.

member.name: M:UI.MenuManager.RemoveMenu(System.String)
member.summary: Removes menu with the given title. Does nothing and returns false if menu doesn't exist.

member.name: M:UI.MenuManager.AddMenuItem(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a command with the given text to the menu with the given name/title

member.name: M:UI.MenuManager.RemoveMenuItem(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Removes the command with the given text from the menu with the given name/title Does nothing and returns false if menu/command combo doesn't currently exist.

member.name: M:UI.MenuManager.TakeOverFileExitDuties
member.summary: Turns off automatic handling of DrawingPanel's File/Exit. After calling this method, your code will be responsible for handling Exit like it handles other custom menu commands.

member.name: P:UI.MenuManager.CommandAvailable
member.summary: Indicates whether there are any unprocessed menu commands

member.name: M:UI.MenuManager.GetFullCommandName
member.summary: Returns menu + command selected by the user - as "menu/command" Commands are returned in the order they were selected. If no command available, throws InvalidOperationException ...so always check CommandAvailable first!!

member.name: M:UI.MenuManager.GetShortCommandName
member.summary: Returns command selected by the user, not including the menu it was selected from Commands are returned in the order they were selected. If no command available, throws InvalidOperationException ...so always check CommandAvailable first!!

member.name: M:UI.MenuManager.FindMenu(System.String)
member.summary: Finds the managed menu with the given name
member.param: menu name as seen by user

member.name: M:UI.MenuManager.FindCommand(System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem,System.String)
member.summary: Finds the given command within the given menu
member.param: menu name as seen by user
command name as seen by user

member.name: M:UI.MouseListener.FlushClickBuffer
member.summary: Clears out any mouse click events recorded before the call to this method

member.name: P:UI.MouseListener.ClickAvailable
member.summary: Indicates whether there are any unprocessed mouse click events

member.name: M:UI.MouseListener.ReadClick
member.summary: Returns mouse click location. Clicks are processed in the order they occured. If no click available, throws InvalidOperationException ...so always check ClickAvailable first!!

member.name: M:UI.KeyListener.KeyDown(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if the given key, specified by character, is currently down Currently recognizes just letters, 0-9 (on main keyboard), and space

member.name: M:UI.KeyListener.KeyDown(UI.SpecialKeys)
member.summary: Returns true if the given key, specified by key code, is currently down

member.name: M:UI.KeyListener.FlushKeyBuffer
member.summary: Clears out any key presses recorded before the call to this method

member.name: P:UI.KeyListener.KeyAvailable
member.summary: Indicates whether there are any unprocessed key presses

member.name: M:UI.KeyListener.ReadKey
member.summary: Returns key typed by the user. Keys are returned in the order they were pressed. If no key available, throws InvalidOperationException ...so always check KeyAvailable first!!

member.name: T:UI.UserInput
member.summary: Provides a means of accessing events and current state for keyboard and mouse

member.name: M:UI.UserInput.FlushKeys
member.summary: Clears out any key presses recorded before the call to this method

member.name: P:UI.UserInput.KeyAvailable
member.summary: Indicates whether there are any unprocessed key presses

member.name: M:UI.UserInput.ReadKey
member.summary: Returns the next key that was typed by the user. If no key available, keeps polling until one is. ...So use KeyAvailable if you don't want to be blocked waiting for a key!

member.name: M:UI.UserInput.KeyDown(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if the given key, specified by character, is currently down. Currently recognizes just letters, 0-9 (on main keyboard), and space

member.name: M:UI.UserInput.KeyDown(UI.SpecialKeys)
member.summary: Returns true if the given key, specified by SpecialKeys code, is currently down

member.name: M:UI.UserInput.FlushClicks
member.summary: Clears out any mouse click events recorded before the call to this method

member.name: P:UI.UserInput.ClickAvailable
member.summary: Indicates whether there are any unprocessed mouse click events

member.name: M:UI.UserInput.ReadClick
member.summary: Returns the next click from the user. If no click available, keeps polling until one is ...So use ClickAvailable if you don't want to be blocked waiting for a click! Note: does not take zoom factor into account

member.name: P:UI.UserInput.CurrentMousePos
member.summary: Most recent recorded position of mouse relative to DrawingPanel. Note: does not take zoom factor into account

member.name: P:UI.UserInput.MouseWithinDisplay
member.summary: True if mouse is currently within the bounds of the drawing surface

member.name: P:UI.UserInput.LeftButtonDown
member.summary: True if left mouse button is currently depressed

member.name: P:UI.UserInput.RightButtonDown
member.summary: True if right mouse button is currently depressed

member.name: P:UI.UserInput.MiddleButtonDown
member.summary: True if middle mouse button is currently depressed

member.name: P:UI.UserInput.MouseButtonDown
member.summary: True if any mouse button is currently depressed
